quest.name: The Hero in Labyrinthos
journal:
 Quest Sync
Verpaulaine is ready to prove he is in the right.

Verpaulaine's father appears just as the boy is about to set off in search of him, and he succeeds in convincing Mussalfret that all is not well. The aetherologist fears, in fact, that the artificial sun may be on the verge of exploding. You are entrusted with gathering some soma cores in order to cool the sun.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.
You obtain the requested cores for Mussalfret. The artificial sun has not yet exploded, which seems like a good sign.

With the soma cores, Mussalfret wastes no time in returning the artificial sun to a state of stability, and disaster is averted thanks to yours and Verpaulaine's efforts. What's more, the boy's relationship with his father seems to have been mended in the process. Verpaulaine bids you visit him in Sharlayan Hamlet once more so he can thank you properly.
Verpaulaine gives you your payment with gratitude and the hope you might meet again once he becomes a researcher in his own right.
objectives: Slay center somas and obtain their cores.
Deliver the soma cores to Mussalfret.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: Come on, let's waste no time in showing this to Father. It's time he acknowledged that I'm right.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: (-???-)So this is where you'd been hiding.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: F-Father! Fancy seeing you here! I was just about to come home and tell you that I found the problem with the sun.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: Are you still harping on about that? You could've got yourself hurt pursuing this nonsense!

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: And you. I told you to bring my son back to me and instead you go off gallivanting with him!?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He's right, you know.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We've got proof that all is not well.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: Fine. I shall hear what you have to say.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: Oh my. I have never seen a core like this in my life. I see no reason to doubt your suggestion that it was feeding on the fire-aspected aether.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: So you finally admit that I was right about the sun?

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: Well, yes... However, that matters not now that I know how serious the situation is.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: What do you mean? Forename's already slain the anala. Surely everything will go back to normal now.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: I'm afraid not.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: If the artificial sun was under such strain for a prolonged period of time, it could be on the verge of combusting by now.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: We'll need to cool it posthaste. Alas, this requires multiple soma cores.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: The constructs can be found by Kokkol's Forge. Please, we've no time to waste─you must retrieve two cores for me.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: We'll begin the process at Phoibos. Find us there when you have the cores in hand.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: You can leave the technical aspects to us. Focus on getting those cores.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: Mother's come to lend us a hand too! Try and get those cores to us soon.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINEMOTHER
dialogue.text: My son has told me all about how you helped him. It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance.

dialogue.name: PHOIBOSSTAFF
dialogue.text: To think all this was happening right under our noses...

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: You've got the cores? Pray give them to my father.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: Did you manage to procure the cores?

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: Splendid! Then let us save our sun.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: All right. I think we can finally relax. The artificial sun is stable once more.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: Clearly, we were all so enveloped in our own research that we neglected to keep an eye on the systems that allow us to live down here in the first place.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: I shudder to think what could have befallen us had you and my son not taken action.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: You have my thanks for saving us from disaster!

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: And I owe you something else, my son. An apology. I was a fool to ignore your warnings simply because of your age.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: It's fine, Father. Really.

dialogue.name: MUSSALFRET
dialogue.text: In that case...might you be interested in helping find potential improvements for the systems that govern our sun?

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: Of course! I can think of several already!

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: Forename, I want to thank you properly for being so helpful. Could you come and visit me again in Sharlayan Hamlet?

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: Thank you again. Here is your reward─it's my pocket money! With an additional something from my parents.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: I was so happy that you listened to me, and decided to trust my knowledge.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: I hope our paths cross again when I have become a researcher in my own right. I'll be sure to make you proud.

dialogue.name: VERPAULAINE
dialogue.text: Until then, do look after yourself, Forename!
